meanings.definition: Select from a large quantity; obtain from a variety of sources.
meanings.sent1: The farmer culled the ripe apples from the tree.
meanings.sent2: She culled the best flowers for the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The chef culled the finest ingredients for the special dish.
meanings.sent4: He carefully culled the gems from the pile of rocks.
meanings.sent5: The teacher culled the most interesting books for the class to read.

meanings.definition: Remove something that is considered undesirable or unnecessary.
meanings.sent1: The librarian culled old books to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent2: They culled the weeds from the garden to allow the flowers to grow.
meanings.sent3: The team culled the weak players to strengthen the squad.
meanings.sent4: She culled the expired items from the pantry to keep it organized.
meanings.sent5: He culled the damaged goods from the inventory to maintain quality.

meanings.definition: Gather or collect information or data from various sources.
meanings.sent1: The researcher culled data from multiple surveys for the study.
meanings.sent2: They culled facts from different books to write the report.
meanings.sent3: The detective culled clues from the crime scene to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: She culled statistics from various reports to analyze the trend.
meanings.sent5: He culled evidence from different sources to support his argument.
